definition: to press against/to support/to prop up/to resist/to equal/to balance/to make up for/to mortgage/to arrive at/to clap (one's hands) lightly (expressing delight) (Taiwan pr. [zhi3] for this sense)
Mt Hua 華山|华山 in Shaanxi/surname Hua
a Jesuit/member of Society of Jesus
the Iwakura mission (Japanese diplomatic and exploratory mission to US and Europe of 1871)
William A.P. Martin (1827-1916), American missionary who lived 62 years in China between 1850 and 1916, and helped found many Chinese colleges, first president of Peking University
to go and visit in an official capacity or for investigation
to set out on a journey
to go home (to one's native country)/to return from abroad
Earl George Macartney (1737-1806), leader of British mission to Qing China in 1793/Paul McCartney, former Beatle
